meanings.definition: To make something more widely known or accessible to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The teacher popularized the new learning method among students.
meanings.sent2: The social media campaign popularized the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The magician popularized the disappearing act at every party.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter popularized joy in the room like a contagious smile.
meanings.sent5: The colorful posters popularized the upcoming concert in town.

meanings.definition: The act of simplifying complex ideas or concepts for a broader audience.
meanings.sent1: The popularization of science books helped students understand difficult topics.
meanings.sent2: The popularization of technology articles made tech news more accessible.
meanings.sent3: The popularization of cooking shows turned complex recipes into easy meals.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had a popularization that made intricate tales seem simple.
meanings.sent5: The popularization of art history made museums more engaging for everyone.
